(714 A.C)%0D%0AHe came from a respectable family.%0D%0A%0D%0A2 His ancestral home was in Yemen, but his great - Aamir -%0D%0Agrandfather settled in Madina after embracing Islam.%0D%0A%0D%0A3 His grandfather - Maalik - was an important Taabi-ee and%0D%0Aa famous reporter of Ahadith.%0D%0A%0D%0A4. Although he is the author of numerous books, his most%0D%0Aimportant work is the KITAB-UL-MUATTA, which deals with%0D%0Athe subject of Islamic Law based on Ahadith and Sunnah.%0D%0AThe Kitab-ul-Muatta is the earliest surviving Book of%0D%0Ait's kind %7B WRITTEN around 150 A.H. %7D and it is used in%0D%0Aall Islamic Institutions as one of the TEXT Books in the%0D%0Afinal year studies by Graduating ULAMA.%0D%0A%0D%0A10. Imam Malik had the highest regard for the Holy Prophet%0D%0A(SAW) as well as for his Ahadith.
